page.title: 09BROCKWOOD PARK, THWAITES
page.content: Brockwood Park is a self-catering holiday centre in Whicham Valley. Visitors stay in lodges on stilts.They are three to four metres apart and have four to six rooms in each. There are 30 lodges set amongst trees. The main facilities are the swimming pool, spa bath and bar. They started to build the swimming pool in late December 1984 and it was officially opened in April 1985. Brockwood is situated in 26 acres of land. There is a nature trail which takes one hour to stroll round .The park is made up of fields, woods, lodges and gardens. In the wood there are deer,foxes, badgers and rabbits. In fact the park is named after the badgers found there. "Brock" means badger. They have four full time and four part time workers. They have 20 cleaners on Saturdays. The park is very popular with visitors and locals.
